title: Very Bad for My Lungs
author: Potty
citation: Potty. "Very Bad for My Lungs: experience with Smoking Blends ('Spice, Mojo, Jah Rush, etc.') (ID 79567)". Erowid.org. Jun 28, 2009. erowid.org/exp/79567
substance: Smoking Blends ('Spice, Mojo, Jah Rush, etc.')
footer: Age at time of experience: Not Given

[ View as PDF (for printing) ] [ View as LaTeX (for geeks) ]
[ Switch Colors ]
report:
As for the effects of Spice or any of the other cannabis substitutes that's been around for the last couple of years, I have nothing to complain about. These products do make me stoned, and the differences to the real thing isn't that obvious.

However, after trying several different products, I can conclude that they are all far harsher on the throat and lungs compared to smoking cannabis or hashish.

I bought 4 different brands and tried, and although I actually gave away at least 4 of my 12 grams to save my lungs the pain, a good week after smoking the last of it I am still not recovered from this ordeal. I can't smoke ordinary cigarettes without pain in my lungs, I feel almost constant pain in my back and have a tired, weak cough that won't go away.
